title: (x) striped faces like this hand drawn type from loveworn.com - various {gang}
content:
Hi,  
I foud this beautiful hand drawn type from [www.loveworn.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20140911043309/http:/www.loveworn.com/ "www.loveworn.com") by Mario Hugo.  
Amazing stuff! I have seen a few typefaces with the multiple lines from the 60's & 70's  
but I am after some names, and ones that have been digitized. Or even more modern  
one that have been made similar. Any help would be greatly appreciated. Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140911043309im_/http:/typophile.com/files/loveworn_3916.gif)
author: Seadreams

comments.content:
Here is another example. Typeface or hand drawn??

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140911043309im_/http:/typophile.com/files/now_now_3586.png)

The style is known as "prisma" which was particularly popular during the 60s and 70s.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140911043309im_/http:/typophile.com/files/churchward_4010.png)

[Chrurchard Design-Lines](http://web.archive.org/web/20140911043309/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/churchward/design-lines/) is just one of many variations. ITC AKI Lines is another, popular as a phototype film font but I haven't seen digitized.

[Dazzle](http://web.archive.org/web/20140911043309/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1048&c=4&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=DET0000260) was recently released by Device.

Also:  
 [Lusta](http://web.archive.org/web/20140911043309/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=lusta)  
 [Pump Triline](http://web.archive.org/web/20140911043309/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=EF.6453.0.5)  
 [Labyrinth](http://web.archive.org/web/20140911043309/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=LH.116764.0.0)  
 [Surreal Post Indian](http://web.archive.org/web/20140911043309/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=TO.104986.0.0)

Norbert,

There was a digitization of ITC Aki Lines in the old Image Club Letterpress CD's (pre-Adobe acquisition era).

- Mike Yanega

Thanks for the update, Mike.

During the heyday of phototype, I remember (and have old catalog samples) PLINC (Photo-Lettering Inc.) and Solotype offering customized "prisma/prismatic" versions of faces. Apparently much was done with lenses, soft-lenses and oil... in other words, smoke & mirrors.
Aki Lines is out there as 'Akka'.
Mike does that suggestion lead to questionable sites?

It wasn't a suggestion. It was a statement of fact. Anyone seeking a digital version of the typeface Aki Lines would, I think, find no other font - the ICG Letterpress CDs having not been offered for years.

I didn't do a Web search for it earlier, but try [DaFont's offering](http://web.archive.org/web/20140911043309/http:/www.dafont.com/font.php?file=akka&page=1&nb_ppp_old=10&text=TIFFONT&nb_ppp=10&classt=alpha).
